text: Ekaterina Aleksandrovna Koroleva (; 8 October 1998 – 7 July 2019) was a Russian handball player who played for Stavropol SKFU. == Biography == Koroleva was born in Krymsk. She was playing with her team Stavropol in the highest Russian women's league. She was also a member of Russian junior national teams. In 2017 she won at the U-19 European Championships in Slovenia the Silver medal after losing the finale against France. Later the Russian team has lost the medal due to a positive doping test by three team members of Koroleva.handball-world.news: Dopingverstöße: EHF Court of Handball erkennt Russland Silber von der Juniorinnen-EM ab, abgerufen am 8. Juli 2019. One year later, she came 4th at the 2018 Women's Junior World Handball Championship.archive.ihf.info: Russia, abgerufen am 8. Juli 2019. Koroleva was not only playing Indoor handball, but also Beach handball. She was member of Russia women's national beach handball team and participated at the 2019 European Beach Handball Championship in Stare Jabłonki, Poland. With the Russian team she ranked in 9th place. On the closing day she died in a swimming accident.Russian beach handball player dies after swimming accident ==References== Category:1998 births Category:2019 deaths Category:People from Krymsk Category:Russian female handball players Category:Beach handball players Category:Deaths by drowning Category:Accidental deaths in Poland
title: Ekaterina Koroleva (handballer)
